dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 588 EAS:
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

engrossed-amendment-form.current-chamber: In the Senate of the United States,

section.text: That the bill from the House of Representatives (H.R. 588) entitled An Act to provide for donor contribution acknowledgments to be displayed at the Vietnam Veterans Memorial Visitor Center, and for other purposes., do pass with the following

amendment-instruction.text: Strike all after the enacting clause and insert the following:

section.text: Section 8905(b) of title 40, United States Code is amended by striking paragraph (7) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, the Secretary or Administrator, as applicable, may permit a sponsor described in subsection (a) to acknowledge donor contributions at the commemorative work.

clause.text: be displayed inside a visitor center or other ancillary structure associated with the commemorative work; and
conform to applicable National Park Service or General Services Administration guidelines for donor recognition, as applicable.
be displayed in a form approved by the Secretary or Administrator;
not include any advertising slogans or company logos.
Prior to the display of donor acknowledgments, the sponsor shall submit to the Secretary or Administrator, as applicable, for approval a plan for displaying the donor acknowledgments, including—

subclause.text: the sample text and types of acknowledgments to be displayed; and
the form and location of all displays.

clause.text: If the Secretary or Administrator does not approve the plan submitted under clause (i), the Secretary or Administrator shall—

subclause.text: not later than 60 days after the date on which the plan is received, notify the sponsor of the reasons the plan is not approved; and
allow the sponsor to resubmit a revised donor acknowledgment plan.

subparagraph.text: The sponsor shall bear all expenses related to the display of donor acknowledgments.
This paragraph shall apply to any commemorative work dedicated after January 1, 2010.

section.header: Extension of legislative authority for vietnam memorial visitor center
section.text: Section 6(b)(5) of Public Law 96–297 (16 U.S.C. 431 note; 124 Stat. 2851) is amended by striking 2014 and inserting 2018.
